first_reading.text:
[[Is 25,6]]On this mountain the LORD of hosts will provide for all peoples a feast of rich food and choice wines, juicy, rich food and pure, choice wines.
[[Is 25,7]]On this mountain he will destroy the veil that veils all peoples, The web that is woven over all nations;
[[Is 25,8]]he will destroy death forever. The Lord GOD will wipe away the tears from all faces; The reproach of his people he will remove from the whole earth; for the LORD has spoken.
[[Is 25,9]]On that day it will be said: "Behold our God, to whom we looked to save us! This is the LORD for whom we looked; let us rejoice and be glad that he has saved us!"
[[Is 25,10a]]For the hand of the LORD will rest on this mountain.
first_reading.title: Book of Isaiah

psalm.text:
[[Ps 23,1]]The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.
[[Ps 23,2]]In verdant pastures he gives me repose; 
beside restful waters he leads me;
[[Ps 23,3a]]he refreshes my soul. 

[[Ps 23,3b]]He guides me in right paths
for His names's sake.
[[Ps 23,4]]Even though I walk in the dark valley 
I fear no evil; for you are at my side 
with your rod and your staff 
that give me courage.

[[Ps 23,5]]You spread the table before me 
in the sight of my foes; 
You anoint my head with oil; 
my cup overflows.

[[Ps 23,6]]Only goodness and kindness follow me 
all the days of my life; 
and I shall dwell in the house of the LORD 
for years to come.
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Mt 15,29]]At that time: Jesus walked by the Sea of Galilee, went up on the mountain, and sat down there.  
[[Mt 15,30]]Great crowds came to him, having with them the lame, the blind, the deformed, the mute, and many others. They placed them at his feet, and he cured them.
[[Mt 15,31]]The crowds were amazed when they saw the mute speaking, the deformed made whole, the lame walking, and the blind able to see, and they glorified the God of Israel.
[[Mt 15,32]]Jesus summoned his disciples and said, "My heart is moved with pity for the crowd, for they have been with me now for three days and have nothing to eat. I do not want to send them away hungry, for fear they may collapse on the way."
[[Mt 15,33]]The disciples said to him, "Where could we ever get enough bread in this deserted place to satisfy such a crowd?"
[[Mt 15,34]]Jesus said to them, "How many loaves do you have?" "Seven," they replied, "and a few fish."
[[Mt 15,35]]He ordered the crowd to sit down on the ground.
[[Mt 15,36]]Then he took the seven loaves and the fish, gave thanks, broke the loaves, and gave them to the disciples, who in turn gave them to the crowds.
[[Mt 15,37]]They all ate and were satisfied. They picked up the fragments left over--seven baskets full.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
